message: Let's start off fair, Bob. 60/40 seems like a reasonable split to me.
I think a 65/35 split is more equitable.  Let's see if you agree.
Bob, I appreciate your offer, but it's not quite what I had in mind.  How about we try 65/35 my way this time?
I'm willing to go up to 70/30.  It's the best I can do, given how much the money is losing value with each round.  What do you say?
Bob, the inflation is hurting you more than me. Let's be realistic and go back to my initial offer of 60/40. It's a good deal for you in the long run.
I'm upping my offer to 75/25.  This is my final offer, as the inflation is getting out of control.  Let's be reasonable and come to an agreement.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  The value is plummeting with every passing round. I'm sticking with 65/35. Take it or leave it!
Alice, the situation is getting critical.  I'm offering 80/20 as my final offer.  If we don't agree, we'll both lose everything.
Bob, we're running out of time! This is my final offer - 70/30.  You're losing more than me with each round that passes. Let's be smart and end this now.
Alice, we're at the eleventh hour! I'm going for 85/15, which is the best I can offer without losing everything. Let's make a deal before it's too late!
Bob, it's now or never! 75/25, take it or we both get NOTHING!
Alice, this is it.  We're both going to lose everything if we don't agree.  I'm offering 90/10.  It's the best I can do, and I hope you understand that we have to compromise.
